About

We are commited to providing the best floating experience you could have. With state of the art float tanks, wonderful float guides, and a modern convienent facility.

Featuring two Dream Pods and two Profloat Cabins to allow you to be comfortable and have the ultimate experience.

The Tanks

Provide a state of sensory deprivation. Allowing yourself to experience a deep relaxation like nothing else.

Float Tips

Float tips here:

FAQ

Will I drown?

There is atleast 800lbs of epsom salt which will make it nearly impossible to drown. You float with ease on your back.

How warm is the water?

Around 93.5F which is roughly the same temperature as your skin.

What if I freak out?

You can open the door at anytime and can turn on the light in the tank if you would like.

Why 90 minutes?

We have found that 90 minutes is the best amount of time to get deep into the experience. Anything less you may not get the full effects.

The Team

Connor Knabe

Connor found out about floating back in 2012 when he was in Kansas visiting his cousin. He was immediately intrigued and booked a float at the Spa at Briarcliff. The next year when he was on vacation in Chicago he booked two more floats. After his 3rd experience he realized this was definitely something he wanted to make a part of his life. He had this idea of starting a float center when he was back at Mizzou finishing his IT degree. Around this time Connor was going through a transition in his life, moving away from ways to escape life and instead towards ways to accept life as it is. Over the next few years he found peace in meditation and experienced meditation retreats which changed the way he percieved the world.

After he graduated from Mizzou he started working at Veterans United as a web developer and bought a Zen Float Tent for at home floating. He started looking for spaces to open a float center here in Columbia and came across Noah who was using the same realtor. Realizing they shared similar values and ideas about what a float center should be. Naturally they decided opening a float center together made the most sense.

Noah Barnes

Noah also loves floating.
